newsitem.title: UK: Enterprise aborts Slyne Trough drilling.
newsitem.headline: Enterprise aborts Slyne Trough drilling.

text.p: Enterprise Oil Plc said on Friday it stopped a two-well drilling programme in the Slyne Trough, west of Ireland, after encountering mechanical problems due to the difficult geological structure of the area.
"It is frustrating, but we haven't given up on the area," a spokesman said. The well already drilled has been plugged and the rig is scheduled to leave the area next week.

Rising costs made it uneconomical to try and overcome the technical problems, the spokesman said. Enterprise may do more seismic research in block 18/20 next year, which in turn could be followed up by renewed drilling, he added.
Enterprise has a 45 percent interest, while Santa Fe has 40 and Statoil 15 percent.
